channel.title: Making a footer 'dynamic'
channel.description: Not sure if dynamic is the right word, but I want the footer to move depending on the length of the page instead of me having to edit every page to make it fit. How can I do this?

item.title: Making a footer 'dynamic'
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Wtf, that shouldn’t work if the generated source is the same as the original html.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a footer 'dynamic'
item.dc:creator: @Kimber Kimber
item.description:
@Kimber wrote:

When I have it at 0px the footer just goes to the middle of the page

EDIT

I put a <?php include("footer.php") ?> at the bottom of the page… All is sorted, thanks for the help!!

Read full topic

item.title: Making a footer 'dynamic'
item.dc:creator: @Braille Braille
item.description:
@Braille wrote:

0px for bottom, not %. I can’t see how my code didn’t work. I just did it on your site and it worked.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a footer 'dynamic'
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Show us your entire html and css. That’s the only way we can help.

EDIT: If you don’t want to show it, I’ll give you some examples of sites I made with floating footers. See if you make sense of it.

http://qknotes.com/
“qknotes ©2007 James Qian and Harold Kim”

http://qknotes.com/oldqknotes
“©2007 James Qian and Harold Kim.”

http://concoolcorporation.com/
“©2007 Sam Mendelson and James Qian”

WARNING!!! NOT APPROVED! DON’T GO IF YOU DON’T TRUST ME!!!11!!!

Basically a site looks like this:
[ Header ]

[ Content ]
[ Content ]
[ Content ]

[ Footer ]

You don’t want to set the footer as a distance from the bottom of the page. Rather, you want to set it from the bottom of the content. If the content increases in size, it ‘pushes’ the footer down with it.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a footer 'dynamic'
item.dc:creator: @Braille Braille
item.description:
@Braille wrote:

#footer {
position: absolute;
width: 100%;
left: 0px;
right:0px;
bottom: 0px;
}

That will align it to the bottom of the page no matter what.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a footer 'dynamic'
item.dc:creator: @Kimber Kimber
item.description:
@Kimber wrote:

I.E I have 2 pages, the text in one page is 600px in height, meaning (without a header) the footer has to be top: 600px;. Another page is 300px in height, meaning the footer has to be top: 300px;. I change these myself to fit the height of the page, is there a way to get it to move automatically?

Read full topic

item.title: Making a footer 'dynamic'
item.dc:creator: @Braille Braille
item.description:
@Braille wrote:

Move where? aligning to the bottom or width wise? Use 100% if you want it to be the full width of the page. If not reply and expand on what you mean please.

Read full topic
